children.name: bone_visibility
children.description: A JSON object that contains a list of key/value pairs that map from bone name in the specified geometry file (key) to a boolean that tells whether the bone should be visible or not (value).

children.name: minecraft:collision_box
children.description: Defines the area of the block that collides with entities. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, the block's collision with entities is disabled. If this component is omitted, default values are used.

children.name: origin
children.description: Minimal position of the bounds of the collision box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

children.name: size
children.description: Size of each side of the collision box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.
Experimental toggles required: Holiday Creator Features

children.name: minecraft:destructible_by_explosion
children.description: Describes the destructible by explosion properties for this block. If set to true, the block will have the default explosion resistance. If set to false, this block is indestructible by explosion. If the component is omitted, the block will have the default explosion resistance.

children.name: explosion_resistance
children.description: Sets the explosion resistance for the block. Greater values result in greater resistance to explosions. The scale will be different for different explosion power levels. A negative value or 0 means it will easily explode; larger numbers increase level of resistance.

children.name: minecraft:destructible_by_mining
children.description: Describes the destructible by mining properties for this block. If set to true, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy. If set to false, this block is indestructible by mining. If the component is omitted, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy.

children.name: seconds_to_destroy
children.description: Sets the number of seconds it takes to destroy the block with base equipment. Greater numbers result in greater mining times.

children.name: minecraft:display_name
children.description: Specifies the language file key that maps to what text will be displayed when you hover over the block in your inventory and hotbar. If the string given can not be resolved as a loc string, the raw string given will be displayed. If this component is omitted, the name of the block will be used as the display name.Experimental toggles required: Holiday Creator Features

children.name: minecraft:flammable
children.description: Describes the flammable properties for this block. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, or if this component is omitted, the block will not be able to catch on fire naturally from neighbors, but it can still be directly ignited.

children.name: catch_chance_modifier
children.description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will catch flame when next to a fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to catch on fire. For a "catch_chance_modifier" greater than 0, the fire will continue to burn until the block is destroyed (or it will burn forever if the "destroy_chance_modifier" is 0). If the "catch_chance_modifier" is 0, and the block is directly ignited, the fire will eventually burn out without destroying the block (or it will have a chance to be destroyed if "destroy_chance_modifier" is greater than 0). The default value of 5 is the same as that of Planks.

children.name: destroy_chance_modifier
children.description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will be destroyed by flames when on fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to be destroyed by fire. For a "destroy_chance_modifier" of 0, the block will never be destroyed by fire, and the fire will burn forever if the "catch_chance_modifier" is greater than 0. The default value of 20 is the same as that of Planks.

children.name: minecraft:friction
children.description: Describes the friction for this block in a range of (0.0-0.9). Friction affects an entity's movement speed when it travels on the block. Greater value results in more friction.

children.name: minecraft:geometry
children.description: The description identifier of the geometry file to use to render this block. This identifier must match an existing geometry identifier in any of the currently loaded resource packs.Experimental toggles required: Holiday Creator Features

children.name: minecraft:light_dampening
children.description: The amount that light will be dampened when it passes through the block, in a range (0-15). Higher value means the light will be dampened more.

children.name: minecraft:light_emission
children.description: The amount of light this block will emit in a range (0-15). Higher value means more light will be emitted.

children.name: minecraft:loot
children.description: The path to the loot table, relative to the behavior pack. Path string is limited to 256 characters.

children.name: minecraft:map_color
children.description: Sets the color of the block when rendered to a map. The color is represented as a hex value in the format "#RRGGBB". May also be expressed as an array of [R, G, B] from 0 to 255. If this component is omitted, the block will not show up on the map.

children.name: minecraft:queued_ticking
children.description: Triggers the specified event, either once, or at a regular interval equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range provided.

children.name: interval_range
children.description: A range of values, specified in ticks, that will be used to decide the interval between times this event triggers. Each interval will be chosen randomly from the range, so the times between this event triggering will differ given an interval_range of two different values. If the values in the interval_range are the same, the event will always be triggered after that number of ticks.

children.name: looping
children.description: Does the event loop? If false, the event will only be triggered once, after a delay equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range. If true, the event will loop, and each interval between events will be equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range.

children.name: on_tick
children.description: The event that will be triggered once or on an interval.

children.name: condition
children.description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the scheduled tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the scheduled tick, the event will not be triggered.

children.name: event
children.description: The event that will be triggered.

children.name: target
children.description: The target of the event executed by the block.

children.name: minecraft:random_ticking
children.description: Triggers the specified event randomly based on the random tick speed gamerule. The random tick speed determines how often blocks are updated. Some other examples of game mechanics that use random ticking are crop growth and fire spreading.

children.name: on_tick
children.description: The event that will be triggered on random ticks.

children.name: condition
children.description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the random tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the random tick, the event will not be triggered.

children.name: event
children.description: The event that will be triggered.

children.name: target
children.description: The target of the event executed by the block.

children.name: minecraft:selection_box
children.description: Defines the area of the block that is selected by the player's cursor. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, this block is not selectable by the player's cursor. If this component is omitted, default values are used.

children.name: origin
children.description: Minimal position of the bounds of the selection box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

children.name: size
children.description: Size of each side of the selection box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.

children.name: minecraft:unit_cube

entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:biome_filter: This component allows the players to specify which biomes the mob spawns in. Check below to see which Biome Tags exist, and what each biome is tagged as.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:brightness_filter: This component allows players to set the light level range that causes the mob to spawn.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:density_limit: This component allows players to determine the density cap limits for the specified mob type.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:difficulty_filter: This component allows players determine what mobs spawn when certain difficulty levels are set.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:herd: This component allows players to determine the herd size of animals.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:spawns_on_surface: This component allows the mob to spawn on the ground. Adding the component causes it to be true, removing it causes the mob to stop spawning on the surface.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:spawns_underwater: This component allows the mob to spawn underwater. Adding the component causes it to be true, removing it causes the mob to stop spawning underwater.
entitySpawnRuleConditionComponent.minecraft:weight: This component allows players to give a priority to how often that mob should spawn. Mobs with lower weight values have a higher chance to spawn than mobs with higher weight values.

entityFilter.actor_health: Tests the health of the subject.
entityFilter.all_slots_empty: Returns true when the designated equipment location for the subject entity is completely empty.
entityFilter.any_slot_empty: Returns true when the designated equipment location for the subject entity has any empty slot.
entityFilter.bool_property: Returns true when the bool actor property matches the value provided.
entityFilter.clock_time: Compares the current time with a float value in the range (0.0, 1.0).
entityFilter.distance_to_nearest_player: Compares the distance to the nearest Player with a float value.
entityFilter.enum_property: Returns true when the enum actor property matches the value provided.
entityFilter.float_property: Returns true when the float actor property matches the value provided.
entityFilter.has_ability: Returns true when the subject entity has the named ability.
entityFilter.has_biome_tag: Tests whether the biome the subject is in has the specified tag.
entityFilter.has_component: Returns true when the subject entity contains the named component.
entityFilter.has_container_open: Returns true when the subject Player entity has opened a container.
entityFilter.has_damage: Returns true when the subject entity receives the named damage type.
entityFilter.has_equipment: Tests for the presence of a named item in the designated slot of the subject entity.
entityFilter.has_mob_effect: Tests whether the Subject has the specified mob effect.
entityFilter.has_nametag: Tests if the subject has been given a custom name.
entityFilter.has_property: Tests for the presence of a property of the subject entity.
entityFilter.has_ranged_weapon: Returns true when the subject entity is holding a ranged weapon like a bow or crossbow.
entityFilter.has_silk_touch: Tests if the subject is holding an item with silk touch.
entityFilter.has_tag: Returns true if the subject entity has the tag provided.
entityFilter.has_target: Returns true if the subject entity has a valid target.
entityFilter.has_trade_supply: Tests whether the target has any trade supply left. Will return false if the target cannot be traded with.
entityFilter.hourly_clock_time: Compares the current 24 hour time with an int value in the range[0, 24000]
entityFilter.in_block: Returns true when the subject entity is inside a specified Block type.
entityFilter.in_caravan: Returns true if the subject entity is in a caravan.
entityFilter.in_clouds: Returns true when the subject entity is in the clouds.
entityFilter.in_contact_with_water: Returns true when the subject entity in contact with any water: water, rain, splash water bottle.
entityFilter.in_lava: Returns true when the subject entity is in lava.
entityFilter.in_nether: Returns true when the subject entity is in Nether.
entityFilter.in_water: Returns true when the subject entity is in water.
entityFilter.in_water_or_rain: Returns true when the subject entity is in water or rain.
entityFilter.inactivity_timer: Tests if the specified duration in seconds of inactivity for despawning has been reached.
entityFilter.int_property: Returns true when the int actor property matches the value provided.
entityFilter.is_altitude: Tests the current altitude against a provided value. 0= bedrock elevation.
entityFilter.is_avoiding_mobs: Returns true if the subject entity is fleeing from other mobs.
entityFilter.is_baby: Returns true when the subject entity is a baby.
entityFilter.is_biome: Tests whether the Subject is currently in the named biome.
entityFilter.is_block: Returns true when the block has the given name.
entityFilter.is_brightness: Tests the current brightness against a provided value in the range (0.0f, 1.0f).
entityFilter.is_climbing: Returns true if the subject entity is climbing.
entityFilter.is_color: Returns true if the subject entity is the named color.
entityFilter.is_daytime: Returns true during the daylight hours.
entityFilter.is_difficulty: Tests the current difficulty level of the game.
entityFilter.is_family: Returns true when the subject entity is a member of the named family.
entityFilter.is_game_rule: Tests whether a named game rule is active.
entityFilter.is_humid: Tests whether the Subject is in an area with humidity
entityFilter.is_immobile: Returns true if the subject entity is immobile. An entity is immobile if it lacks AI goals, has just changed dimensions or if it is a mob and has no health.
entityFilter.is_in_village: Tests whether the Subject is inside the bounds of a village.
entityFilter.is_leashed: Returns true if the subject entity is leashed.
entityFilter.is_leashed_to: Returns true if the subject entity leashed to the calling entity.
entityFilter.is_mark_variant: Returns true if the subject entity is the mark variant number provided.
entityFilter.is_missing_health: Tests if the subject is not at full health.
entityFilter.is_moving: Returns true if the subject entity is moving.
entityFilter.is_owner: Returns true if the subject entity is the owner of the calling entity.
entityFilter.is_persistent: Tests if the subject's persistence matches the bool value passed in.
entityFilter.is_raider: Tests if the subject is a raider.
entityFilter.is_riding: Returns true if the subject entity is riding on another entity.
entityFilter.is_skin_id: Returns true if the subject entity is the skin id number provided.
entityFilter.is_sleeping: Tests whether the Subject is sleeping.
entityFilter.is_sneaking: Returns true if the subject entity is sneaking.
entityFilter.is_snow_covered: Tests whether the Subject is in an area with snow cover
entityFilter.is_target: Returns true if the subject entity is the target of the calling entity.
entityFilter.is_temperature_type: Tests whether the current temperature is a given type.
entityFilter.is_temperature_value: Tests the current temperature against a provided value in the range (0.0, 1.0) where 0.0f is the coldest temp and 1.0f is the hottest.
entityFilter.is_underground: Returns true when the subject entity is underground. An entity is considered underground if there are non-solid blocks above it.
entityFilter.is_underwater: Returns true when the subject entity is under water. An entity is considered underwater if it is completely submerged in water blocks.
entityFilter.is_variant: Returns true if the subject entity is the variant number provided.
entityFilter.is_visible: Returns true if the subject entity is visible.
entityFilter.is_waterlogged: Tests if the subject block is submerged in water.
entityFilter.light_level: Tests is the mob is outside of the specified light level range (0, 16).
entityFilter.moon_intensity: Compares the current moon intensity with a float value in the range (0.0, 1.0)
entityFilter.moon_phase: Compares the current moon phase with an integer value in the range (0, 7).
entityFilter.on_fire: Tests if the subject is on fire.
entityFilter.on_ground: Returns true when the subject entity is on ground.
entityFilter.on_hot_block: Tests if the subject is on a hot block.
entityFilter.on_ladder: Returns true when the subject entity is on a ladder.
entityFilter.random_chance: Returns true if the random chance rolls 0 out of a specified max range.
entityFilter.rider_count: Returns the number of riders on this entity.
entityFilter.surface_mob: Tests if the subject is a surface mob.
entityFilter.taking_fire_damage: Tests if the subject is taking fire damage. Requires the damage_sensor component
entityFilter.target_distance: Tests the distance between the calling entity and its target.
entityFilter.trusts: Returns true if the subject is trusted by entity.
entityFilter.weather: Tests the current weather in the dimension against a provided weather value.
entityFilter.weather_at_position: Tests the current weather, at the actor's position, against a provided weather value.

children.name: height_above_target_range
children.description: The number of blocks above the target that the next anchor point can be set. This value is used only when the entity is tracking a target.

children.name: height_adjustment_chance
children.description: Percent chance to determine how often to increase or decrease the current height around the anchor point. 1 = 100%. "height_change_chance" is deprecated and has been replaced with "height_adjustment_chance".

children.name: height_offset_range
children.description: Vertical distance from the anchor point this entity must stay within, upon a successful height adjustment.

children.name: radius_adjustment_chance
children.description: Percent chance to determine how often to increase the size of the current movement radius around the anchor point. 1 = 100%. "radius_change_chance" is deprecated and has been replaced with "radius_adjustment_chance".

children.name: radius_change
children.description: The number of blocks to increase the current movement radius by, upon successful "radius_adjustment_chance". If the current radius increases over the range maximum, the current radius will be set back to the range minimum and the entity will change between clockwise and counter-clockwise movement..

children.name: radius_range
children.description: Horizontal distance from the anchor point this entity must stay within upon a successful radius adjustment.

children.name: speed_multiplier
children.description: Multiplies the speed at which this entity travels to its next desired position.

minecraft:behavior.controlled_by_player.description: Allows the entity to be controlled by the player using an item in the item_controllable property (required). Also requires the minecraft:movement property, and the minecraft:rideable property. On every tick, the entity will attempt to rotate towards where the player is facing with the control item whilst simultaneously moving forward.

children.name: fractional_rotation
children.description: The entity will attempt to rotate to face where the player is facing each tick. The entity will target this percentage of their difference in their current facing angles each tick (from 0.0 to 1.0 where 1.0 = 100%). This is limited by FractionalRotationLimit. A value of 0.0 will result in the entity no longer turning to where the player is facing.

children.name: fractional_rotation_limit
children.description: Limits the total degrees the entity can rotate to face where the player is facing on each tick.

children.name: mount_speed_multiplier
children.description: Speed multiplier of mount when controlled by player.

minecraft:behavior.croak.description: Allows the entity to croak at a random time interval with configurable conditions.

children.name: duration
children.description: Random range in seconds after which the croaking stops. Can also be a constant.

children.name: filters
children.description: Conditions for the behavior to start and keep running. The interval between runs only starts after passing the filters.

children.name: interval
children.description: Random range in seconds between runs of this behavior. Can also be a constant.

minecraft:behavior.defend_trusted_target.description: Allows the mob to target another mob that hurts an entity it trusts.

children.name: aggro_sound
children.description: Sound to occasionally play while defending.

children.name: attack_interval
children.description: Time in seconds between attacks

children.name: entity_types
children.description: List of entity types that this mob considers valid targets

children.name: cooldown
children.description: The amount of time in seconds that the mob has to wait before selecting a target of the same type again

children.name: filters
children.description: Conditions that make this entry in the list valid

children.name: max_dist
children.description: Maximum distance this mob can be away to be a valid choice

children.name: must_see
children.description: If true, the mob has to be visible to be a valid choice

children.name: must_see_forget_duration
children.description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

children.name: reevaluate_description
children.description: If true, the mob will stop being targeted if it stops meeting any conditions.

children.name: sprint_speed_multiplier
children.description: Multiplier for the running speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

children.name: walk_speed_multiplier
children.description: Multiplier for the walking speed. A value of 1.0 means the speed is unchanged

children.name: must_see
children.description: If true, only entities in this mob's viewing range can be selected as targets

children.name: must_see_forget_duration
children.description: Determines the amount of time in seconds that this mob will look for a target before forgetting about it and looking for a new one when the target isn't visible any more

minecraft:behavior.defend_village_target.description: Allows the entity to stay in a village and defend the village from aggressors. If a player is in bad standing with the village this goal will cause the entity to attack the player regardless of filter conditions.

children.name: attack_chance
children.description: The percentage chance that the entity has to attack aggressors of its village, where 1.0 = 100%.

minecraft:behavior.delayed_attack.description: Allows an entity to attack, while also delaying the damage-dealt until a specific time in the attack animation.

children.name: attack_duration
children.description: The entity's attack animation will play out over this duration (in seconds). Also controls attack cooldown.

children.name: attack_once
children.description: Allows the entity to use this attack behavior, only once EVER.

children.name: attack_types
children.description: Defines the entity types this entity will attack.

children.name: cooldown_time
children.description: Cooldown time (in seconds) between attacks.

children.name: hit_delay_pct
children.description: The percentage into the attack animation to apply the damage of the attack (1.0 = 100%).

children.name: inner_boundary_time_increase
children.description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_inner_boundary".

children.name: max_dist
children.description: Unused. No effect on "minecraft:behavior.melee_attack".

children.name: max_path_time
children.description: Maximum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

children.name: melee_fov
children.description: Field of view (in degrees) when using the sensing component to detect an attack target.

children.name: min_path_time
children.description: Minimum base time (in seconds) to recalculate new attack path to target (before increases applied).

children.name: on_attack
children.description: Defines the event to trigger when this entity successfully attacks.

children.name: outer_boundary_time_increase
children.description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when the target is beyond the "path_outer_boundary".

children.name: path_fail_time_increase
children.description: Time (in seconds) to add to attack path recalculation when this entity cannot move along the current path.

children.name: path_inner_boundary
children.description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "inner_boundary_tick_increase".

children.name: path_outer_boundary
children.description: Distance at which to increase attack path recalculation by "outer_boundary_tick_increase".

children.name: random_stop_interval
children.description: This entity will have a 1 in N chance to stop it's current attack, where N = "random_stop_interval".

children.name: reach_multiplier
children.description: Used with the base size of the entity to determine minimum target-distance before trying to deal attack damage.

children.name: require_complete_path
children.description: Toggles (on/off) the need to have a full path from the entity to the target when using this melee attack behavior.

children.name: set_persistent
children.description: Allows the actor to be set to persist upon targeting a player

children.name: speed_multiplier
children.description: This multiplier modifies the attacking entity's speed when moving toward the target.

children.name: target_dist
children.description: Unused. No effect on "minecraft:behavior.melee_attack".

children.name: track_target
children.description: Allows the entity to track the attack target, even if the entity has no sensing.

children.name: x_max_rotation
children.description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the X-axis, this entity can rotate while trying to look at the target.

children.name: y_max_head_rotation
children.description: Maximum rotation (in degrees), on the Y-axis, this entity can rotate its head while trying to look at the target.

children.description: Indicates that the actor should start digging when it sees daylight

minecraft:economy_trade_table.description: Defines this entity's ability to trade with players.

children.name: convert_trades_economy
children.description: Determines when the mob transforms, if the trades should be converted when the new mob has a economy_trade_table. When the trades are converted, the mob will generate a new trade list with their new trade table, but then it will try to convert any of the same trades over to have the same enchantments and user data. For example, if the original has a Emerald to Enchanted Iron Sword (Sharpness 1), and the new trade also has an Emerald for Enchanted Iron Sword, then the enchantment will be Sharpness 1.

children.name: cured_discount
children.description: How much should the discount be modified by when the player has cured the Zombie Villager. Can be specified as a pair of numbers (low-tier trade discount and high-tier trade discount)

children.name: display_name

children.name: max_cured_discount

children.name: max_nearby_cured_discount

children.name: nearby_cured_discount
children.description: How much should the discount be modified by when the player has cured a nearby Zombie Villager

children.name: new_screen
children.description: Used to determine if trading with entity opens the new trade screen

children.name: persist_trades
children.description: Determines if the trades should persist when the mob transforms. This makes it so that the next time the mob is transformed to something with a trade_table or economy_trade_table, then it keeps their trades.

children.name: show_trade_screen
children.description: Show an in game trade screen when interacting with the mob.

children.name: emit_swim

minecraft:genetics.description: Defines the way a mob's genes and alleles are passed on to its offspring, and how those traits manifest in the child. Compatible parent genes are crossed together, the alleles are handed down from the parents to the child, and any matching genetic variants fire off JSON events to modify the child and express the traits.

children.name: genes
children.description: The list of genes that this entity has and will cross with a partner during breeding.

children.name: allele_range
children.description: The range of positive integer allele values for this gene. Spawned mobs will have a random number in this range assigned to them.

children.name: range_max
children.description: Upper bound of the allele values for this gene.

children.name: range_min
children.description: Lower bound of the allele values for this gene.

children.name: genetic_variants
children.description: The list of genetic variants for this gene. These check for particular allele combinations and fire events when all of them are satisfied.

children.name: birth_event
children.description: Event to run when this mob is created and matches the allele conditions.

children.name: both_allele
children.description: If this value is non-negative, compare both the mob's main and hidden alleles with this value for a match with both. Can also be a range of integers.

children.name: either_allele

children.name: hidden_allele
children.description: If this value is non-negative, compare the mob's hidden allele with this value for a match. Can also be a range of integers.

children.name: main_allele
children.description: If this value is non-negative, compare the mob's main allele with this value for a match. Can also be a range of integers.

children.name: mutation_rate
children.description: If this value is non-negative, overrides the chance for this gene that an allele will be replaced with a random one instead of the parent's allele during birth. Non-negative values greater than `1` will be the same as the value `1`.

children.name: name
children.description: The name of the gene.

children.name: mutation_rate
children.description: Chance that an allele will be replaced with a random one instead of the parent's allele during birth.

minecraft:giveable.description: Defines sets of items that can be used to trigger events when used on this entity. The item will also be taken and placed in the entity's inventory.

children.name: cooldown
children.description: An optional cool down in seconds to prevent spamming interactions.

children.name: items
children.description: The list of items that can be given to the entity to place in their inventory.

children.name: on_give
children.description: Event to fire when the correct item is given.

minecraft:group_size.description: Keeps track of entity group size in the given radius.

children.name: filters
children.description: The list of conditions that must be satisfied for other entities to be counted towards group size.

children.name: radius
children.description: Radius from center of entity.

minecraft:grows_crop.description: Could increase crop growth when entity walks over crop

children.name: chance
children.description: Value between 0-1. Chance of success per tick.

children.name: charges
children.description: Number of charges

minecraft:healable.description: Defines the interactions with this entity for healing it.

children.name: filters
children.description: The filter group that defines the conditions for using this item to heal the entity.

children.name: force_use
children.description: Determines if item can be used regardless of entity being at full health.

children.name: items
children.description: The array of items that can be used to heal this entity.

children.name: heal_amount
children.description: The amount of health this entity gains when fed this item.

children.name: item
children.description: Item identifier that can be used to heal this entity.

children.name: interval
children.description: A Molang expression defining the inter-beat interval in seconds. A value of zero or less means no heartbeat.

children.name: sound_event
children.description: Level sound event to be played as the heartbeat sound.

minecraft:home.description: Saves a home pos for when the the entity is spawned.

children.name: restriction_radius
children.description: The radius that the entity will be restricted to in relation to its home

minecraft:hurt_on_condition.description: Defines a set of conditions under which an entity should take damage.

minecraft:inside_block_notifier.description: Verifies whether the entity is inside any of the listed blocks.

minecraft:insomnia.description: Adds a timer since last rested to see if phantoms should spawn.

children.name: add_items

children.name: spawn_items

children.name: table
children.description: File path, relative to the Behavior Pack's path, to the loot table file.

children.description: If true, the interaction will use an item.

children.name: vibration
children.description: Vibration to emit when the interaction occurs. Admitted values are entity_interact (used by default), shear, and none (no vibration emitted).

children.name: additional_slots_per_strength

children.description: Number of slots the container has

children.description: If true, the entity will not drop its inventory on death

children.description: If true, the entity's inventory can only be accessed by its owner or itself

When the trades are converted, the mob will generate a new trade list with their new trade table, but then it will try to convert any of the same trades over to have the same enchantments and user data. For example, if the original has a Emerald to Enchanted Iron Sword (Sharpness 1), and the new trade also has an Emerald for Enchanted Iron Sword, then the enchantment will be Sharpness 1.

entityTrigger.minecraft:on_death: Only usable by the Ender Dragon. Adds a trigger to call on this entity's death.

entityTrigger.minecraft:on_start_landing: Only usable by the Ender Dragon. Adds a trigger to call when this entity lands.
entityTrigger.minecraft:on_start_takeoff: Only usable by the Ender Dragon. Adds a trigger to call when this entity starts flying.
entityTrigger.minecraft:on_target_acquired: Adds a trigger to call when this entity finds a target.
