entityTrigger.minecraft:on_wake_with_owner: Adds a trigger to call when this pet's owner awakes after sleeping with the pet.

featureType.minecraft:aggregate_feature: 'minecraft:aggregate_feature' places a collection of features in an arbitary order. All features in the collection use the same input position. Features should not depend on each other, as there is no guarantee on the order the features will be placed.
featureType.minecraft:sequence_feature: 'minecraft:sequence_feature' places a collection of features sequentially, in the order they appear in data. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position for the next. For example, a tree feature is placed at (0, 0, 0) and places blocks up to (0, 10, 0). The next feature in the sequence begins at (0, 10, 0).
featureType.minecraft:beards_and_shavers: 'minecraft:beards_and_shavers' will build a 'beard' or 'shave' out space so as to provide a clear space for a feature to place.
featureType.minecraft:cave_carver_feature: 'minecraft:cave_carver_feature' carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass "pregeneration_pass".
featureType.minecraft:conditional_list: 'minecraft:conditional_list' Places the first suitable feature within a collection.
featureType.minecraft:fossil_feature: 'minecraft:fossil_feature' generates a skeletal structure composed of bone blocks and parametric ore blocks.Succeeds if: The fossil is placed.
featureType.minecraft:geode_feature: 'minecraft:geode_feature' generates a rock formation to simulate a geode. Each layer of, and block within, the geode can be replaced. Succeeds if: At least one block within the geode is placed.
featureType.minecraft:growing_plant_feature: 'minecraft:growing_plant_feature' places a growing plant in the world. A growing plant is a column that is anchored either to the ceiling or the floor, based on its growth direction.
featureType.minecraft:hell_cave_carver_feature: 'minecraft:hell_cave_carver_feature' carves a cave through the Nether in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass "pregeneration_pass".
featureType.minecraft:multiface_feature: 'minecraft:multiface_feature' places one or a few multiface blocks on floors/walls/ceilings. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if this feature can be placed on them based on the list provided in the 'can_place_on' field. If no 'can_replace_on' field is specified, the 'place_block' block can be placed on any existing block.
featureType.minecraft:ore_feature: 'minecraft:ore_feature' places a vein of blocks to simulate ore deposits. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if they can be replaced by the new ore block based on the list provided in the 'may_replace' field of a 'replace_rules' entry. If no 'may_replace' field is specified in a 'replace_rule' entry, the ore block can replace any existing block.
featureType.minecraft:partially_exposed_blob_feature: 'minecraft:partially_exposed_blob_feature' generates a blob of the specified block with the specified dimensions For the most part the blob is embedded in the specified surface, however a single side is allowed to be exposed.
featureType.minecraft:rect_layout: 'minecraft:rect_layout' scans the surface of a Chunk, calling place() on the surface of each block column.
featureType.minecraft:scan_surface: 'minecraft:scan_surface' scans the surface of a Chunk, calling place() on the surface of each block column.
featureType.minecraft:scatter_feature: 'minecraft:scatter_feature' scatters a feature throughout a chunk. The 'x', 'y', and 'z' fields are per-coordinate parameters. Note that coordinates represent an offset from the input position, not an absolute position. Coordinates may be a single value, a random distribution, or Molang expression that resolves to a numeric value. The 'coordinate_eval_order' field is provided for finer control of coordinate resolution (particularly when using the 'grid' distribution). 'iterations' controls how many individual placements should occur if the 'scatter_chance' check succeeds. The 'scatter_chance' check happens once, so either all placements will run or none will.
featureType.minecraft:sculk_patch_feature: Feature type 'minecraft:sculk_patch_feature' has not yet been documented.
featureType.minecraft:search_feature: 'minecraft:search_feature' sweeps a volume searching for a valid placement location for its referenced feature. The 'search_volume' field specifies the axis-aligned bounding box that defines the boundaries of the search. The search sweeps along the axis defined by the 'search_axis' field, layer by layer. For example, if 'search_axis' = '-x', blocks with greater x values will be checked before blocks with lower x values. Each layer is searched from the bottom-left to the top-right before moving to the next layer along the axis. By default, only one valid position must be found, but this can be altered by specifying the 'required_successes' field. If fewer than the required successes are found, no placement will occur.
featureType.minecraft:single_block_feature: 'minecraft:single_block_feature' places a single block in the world. The 'may_place_on' and 'may_replace' fields are allowlists which specify where the block can be placed. If these fields are omitted, the block can be placed anywhere. The block's internal survivability and placement rules can optionally be enforced with the 'enforce_survivability_rules' and 'enforce_placement_rules' fields. These rules are specified per-block and are typically designed to produce high quality gameplay or natural behavior. However, enabling this enforcement may make it harder to debug placement failures.
featureType.minecraft:snap_to_surface_feature: 'minecraft:snap_to_surface_feature' snaps the y-value of a feature placement pos to the floor or the ceiling within the provided 'vertical_search_range'. The placement biome is preserved. If the snap position goes outside of the placement biome, placement will fail.
featureType.minecraft:structure_template_feature: 'minecraft:structure_template_feature' places a structure in the world. The structure must be stored as a .mcstructure file in the "structures" subdirectory of a behavior pack. It is possible to reference structures that are part of other behavior packs, they do not need to come from the same behavior pack as this feature. Constraints can be defined to specify where the structure is allowed to be placed. During placement, the feature will search for a position within the 'adjustment_radius' that satisfies all constraints. If none are found, the structure will not be placed.
featureType.minecraft:surface_relative_threshold_fea: 'minecraft:surface_relative_threshold_feature' determines whether the provided position is below the estimated surface level of the world, and places a feature if so.If the provided position is above configured surface or the surface is not available, placement will fail. This feature only works for Overworld generators using world generation 1.18 or later.
featureType.minecraft:underwater_cave_carver_feature: 'minecraft:underwater_cave_carver_feature' carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will specifically target creating caves only below sea level.
featureType.minecraft:tree_feature: Feature type 'minecraft:tree_feature' has not yet been documented.
featureType.minecraft:vegetation_patch_feature: Feature type 'minecraft:vegetation_patch_feature' has not yet been documented.
featureType.minecraft:weighted_random_feature: 'minecraft:weighted_random_feature' randomly selects and places a feature based on a weight value. Weights are relative, with higher values making selection more likely.

itemComponent.minecraft:armor: The armor item component determines the amount of protection you have in your armor item.
itemComponent.minecraft:block_placer: Planter item component. planter items are items that can be planted.
itemComponent.minecraft:chargeable: Allows an item to be used over a duration.
itemComponent.minecraft:cooldown: Cool down time for a component. After you use an item it becomes unusable for the duration specified by the 'cool down time' setting in this component.
itemComponent.minecraft:digger: Digger item. Component put on items that dig.
itemComponent.minecraft:display_name: Display Name item component. Display Names set the name to display when an item is in use or hovered over.
itemComponent.minecraft:durability: A property that determines when an item will break from use. The durability of an item is potentially depleted upon use based on the damage chance.
itemComponent.minecraft:entity_placer: Entity placer item component. You can specifiy allowed blocks that the item is restricted to.
itemComponent.minecraft:food: When an item has a food component, it becomes edible to the player.
itemComponent.minecraft:fuel: Allows this item to be used as fuel in a furnace to 'cook' other items.
itemComponent.minecraft:icon: The icon item component determines the icon to represent the item.
itemComponent.minecraft:item_storage: The Storage Item Component is used for storing Items within an Item's User Data
itemComponent.minecraft:on_use: The on_use item component allows you to receive an event when the item is used.
itemComponent.minecraft:on_use_on: The on_use_on item component allows you to receive an event when the item is used on a block in the world.
itemComponent.minecraft:projectile: Projectile item component. projectile items shoot out, like an arrow.
itemComponent.minecraft:record: Record Item Component.  Used by record items to play music.
itemComponent.minecraft:render_offsets: Render offsets component: optional values can be given to offset the way the item is rendered.
itemComponent.minecraft:repairable: Repairable item component: how much damage can this item repair, what items can repair it.
itemComponent.minecraft:throwable: Throwable item component. Throwable items, such as a snowball.
itemComponent.minecraft:weapon: Weapon Item Component. Added to every weapon item such as axe, sword, trident, bow, crossbow.

molangMath.math.atan2(y, x): arctan of y/x.  NOTE: the order of arguments!
molangMath.math.ceil(value): Round value up to nearest integral number
molangMath.math.clamp(value, min, max): Clamp value to between min and max inclusive
molangMath.math.die_roll(num, low, high): returns the sum of 'num' random numbers, each with a value from low to high`.  Note: the generated random numbers are not integers like normal dice.  For that, use `math.die_roll_integer`.
molangMath.math.die_roll_integer(num, low, high): returns the sum of 'num' random integer numbers, each with a value from low to high`.  Note: the generated random numbers are integers like normal dice.
molangMath.math.exp(value): Calculates e to the value'th power
molangMath.math.floor(value): Round value down to nearest integral number
molangMath.math.hermite_blend(value): Useful for simple smooth curve interpolation using one of the Hermite Basis functions: `3t^2 - 2t^3`.  Note that while any valid float is a valid input, this function works best in the range [0,1].
molangMath.math.lerp(start, end, 0_to_1): Lerp from start to end via 0_to_1
molangMath.math.lerprotate(start, end, 0_to_1): Lerp the shortest direction around a circle from start degrees to end degrees via 0_to_1
molangMath.math.max(A, B): Return highest value of A or B
molangMath.math.min(A, B): Return lowest value of A or B
molangMath.math.min_angle(value): Minimize angle magnitude (in degrees) into the range [-180, 180)
molangMath.math.mod(value, denominator): Return the remainder of value / denominator
molangMath.math.pi: Returns the float representation of the constant pi.
molangMath.math.random(low, high): Random value between low and high inclusive
molangMath.math.random_integer(low, high): Random integer value between low and high inclusive
molangMath.math.round(value): Round value to nearest integral number

molangQuery.query.above_top_solid: Returns the height of the block immediately above the highest solid block at the input (x,z) position
molangQuery.query.actor_count: Returns the number of actors rendered in the last frame.
molangQuery.query.all: Requires at least 3 arguments. Evaluates the first argument, then returns 1.0 if all of the following arguments evaluate to the same value as the first. Otherwise it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.all_animations_finished: Only valid in an animation controller.  Returns 1.0 if all animations in the current animation controller state have played through at least once, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.all_tags: Returns if the item or block has all of the tags specified.
molangQuery.query.anger_level: Returns the anger level of the actor [0,n). On errors or if the actor has no anger level, returns 0. Available on the Server only.
molangQuery.query.anim_time: Returns the time in seconds since the current animation started, else 0.0 if not called within an animation.
molangQuery.query.any: Requires at least 3 arguments. Evaluates the first argument, then returns 1.0 if any of the following arguments evaluate to the same value as the first. Otherwise it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.any_animation_finished: Only valid in an animation controller.  Returns 1.0 if any animation in the current animation controller state has played through at least once, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.any_tag: Returns if the item or block has any of the tags specified.
molangQuery.query.approx_eq: Returns 1.0 if all of the arguments are within 0.000000 of each other, else 0.0.
molangQuery.query.armor_color_slot: Takes the armor slot index as a parameter, and returns the color of the armor in the requested slot.
molangQuery.query.armor_material_slot: Takes the armor slot index as a parameter, and returns the armor material type in the requested armor slot.
molangQuery.query.armor_texture_slot: Takes the armor slot index as a parameter, and returns the texture type of the requested slot.
molangQuery.query.average_frame_time: Returns the time in *seconds* of the average frame time over the last 'n' frames.  If an argument is passed, it is assumed to be the number of frames in the past that you wish to query.  'query.average_frame_time' (or the equivalent 'query.average_frame_time(0)') will return the frame time of the frame before the current one.  'query.average_frame_time(1)' will return the average frame time of the previous two frames.  Currently we store the history of the last 30 frames, although note that this may change in the future.  Asking for more frames will result in only sampling the number of frames stored.
molangQuery.query.block_face: Returns the block face for this (only valid for certain triggers such as placing blocks, or interacting with block) (Down=0.0, Up=1.0, North=2.0, South=3.0, West=4.0, East=5.0, Undefined=6.0).
molangQuery.query.block_property: Returns the value of the associated Blocks Block State.
molangQuery.query.blocking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is blocking, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.body_x_rotation: Returns the body pitch rotation if called on an actor, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.body_y_rotation: Returns the body yaw rotation if called on an actor, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.bone_aabb: Returns the axis aligned bounding box of a bone as a struct with members '.min', '.max', along with '.x', '.y', and '.z' values for each.
molangQuery.query.bone_origin: Returns the initial (from the .geo) pivot of a bone as a struct with members '.x', '.y', and '.z'.
molangQuery.query.bone_rotation: Returns the initial (from the .geo) rotation of a bone as a struct with members '.x', '.y', and '.z' in degrees.
molangQuery.query.camera_distance_range_lerp: Takes two distances (any order) and return a number from 0 to 1 based on the camera distance between the two ranges clamped to that range.  For example, 'query.camera_distance_range_lerp(10, 20)' will return 0 for any distance less than or equal to 10, 0.2 for a distance of 12, 0.5 for 15, and 1 for 20 or greater.  If you pass in (20, 10), a distance of 20 will return 0.0.
molangQuery.query.camera_rotation: Returns the rotation of the camera.  Requires one argument representing the rotation axis you would like (0 for x, 1 for y).
molangQuery.query.can_climb: Returns 1.0 if the entity can climb, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.can_damage_nearby_mobs: Returns 1.0 if the entity can damage nearby mobs, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.can_dash: Returns 1.0 if the entity can dash, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.can_fly: Returns 1.0 if the entity can fly, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.can_power_jump: Returns 1.0 if the entity can power jump, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.can_swim: Returns 1.0 if the entity can swim, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.can_walk: Returns 1.0 if the entity can walk, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.cape_flap_amount: Returns value between 0.0 and 1.0 with 0.0 meaning cape is fully down and 1.0 is cape is fully up.
molangQuery.query.cardinal_block_face_placed_on: DEPRECATED (please use query.block_face instead) Returns the block face for this (only valid for on_placed_by_player trigger) (Down=0.0, Up=1.0, North=2.0, South=3.0, West=4.0, East=5.0, Undefined=6.0).
molangQuery.query.cardinal_facing: Returns the current facing of the player (Down=0.0, Up=1.0, North=2.0, South=3.0, West=4.0, East=5.0, Undefined=6.0).
molangQuery.query.cardinal_facing_2d: Returns the current facing of the player ignoring up/down part of the direction (North=2.0, South=3.0, West=4.0, East=5.0, Undefined=6.0).
molangQuery.query.cardinal_player_facing: Returns the current facing of the player (Down=0.0, Up=1.0, North=2.0, South=3.0, West=4.0, East=5.0, Undefined=6.0).
molangQuery.query.combine_entities: Combines any valid entity references from all arguments into a single array.  Note that order is not preserved, and duplicates and invalid values are removed.
molangQuery.query.count: Counts the number of things passed to it (arrays are counted as the number of elements they contain; non-arrays count as 1).
molangQuery.query.current_squish_value: Returns the squish value for the current entity, or 0.0 if this doesn't make sense.
molangQuery.query.dash_cooldown_progress: Returns dash cooldown progress if the entity can dash, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.day: Returns the day of the current level.
molangQuery.query.death_ticks: Returns the elapsed ticks since the mob started dying.
molangQuery.query.debug_output: debug log a value to the output debug window for builds that have one
molangQuery.query.delta_time: Returns the time in seconds since the previous frame.
molangQuery.query.distance_from_camera: Returns the distance of the root of this actor or particle emitter from the camera.
molangQuery.query.effect_emitter_count: Returns the total number of active emitters of the callee's particle effect type.
molangQuery.query.effect_particle_count: Returns the total number of active particles of the callee's particle effect type.
molangQuery.query.equipment_count: Returns the number of equipped armor pieces for an actor from 0 to 4, not counting items held in hands. (To query for hand slots, use query.is_item_equipped or query.is_item_name_any).
molangQuery.query.equipped_item_all_tags: Takes a slot name followed by any tag you want to check for in the form of 'tag_name' and returns 1 if all of the tags are on that equipped item, 0 otherwise.
molangQuery.query.equipped_item_any_tag: Takes a slot name followed by any tag you want to check for in the form of 'tag_name' and returns 0 if none of the tags are on that equipped item or 1 if at least 1 tag exists.
molangQuery.query.equipped_item_is_attachable: Takes the desired hand slot as a parameter (0 or 'main_hand' for main hand, 1 or 'off_hand' for off hand), and returns whether the item is an attachable or not.
molangQuery.query.eye_target_x_rotation: Returns the X eye rotation of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.eye_target_y_rotation: Returns the Y eye rotation of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.facing_target_to_range_attack: Returns 1.0 if the entity is attacking from range (i.e. minecraft:behavior.ranged_attack), else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.frame_alpha: Returns the ratio (from 0 to 1) of how much between AI ticks this frame is being rendered.
molangQuery.query.get_actor_info_id: Returns the integer id of an actor by its string name.
molangQuery.query.get_animation_frame: Returns the current texture of the item
molangQuery.query.get_default_bone_pivot: Gets specified axis of the specified bone orientation pivot.
molangQuery.query.get_equipped_item_name: DEPRECATED (Use query.is_item_name_any instead if possible so names can be changed later without breaking content.) Takes one optional hand slot as a parameter (0 or 'main_hand' for main hand, 1 or 'off_hand' for off hand), and a second parameter (0=default) if you would like the equipped item or any non-zero number for the currently rendered item, and returns the name of the item in the requested slot (defaulting to the main hand if no parameter is supplied) if there is one, otherwise returns ''.
molangQuery.query.get_locator_offset: Gets specified axis of the specified locator offset.
molangQuery.query.get_name: DEPRECATED (Use query.is_name_any instead if possible so names can be changed later without breaking content.)Get the name of the mob if there is one, otherwise return ''.
molangQuery.query.get_root_locator_offset: Gets specified axis of the specified locator offset of the root model.
molangQuery.query.ground_speed: Returns the ground speed of the entity in meters/second.
molangQuery.query.had_component_group: Usable only in behavior packs when determining the default value for an entity's Property. Requires one string argument. If the entity is being loaded from data that was last saved with a component_group with the specified name, returns 1.0, otherwise returns 0.0. The purpose of this query is to allow entity definitions to change and still be able to load the correct state of entities.
molangQuery.query.has_any_family: Returns 1 if the entity has any of the specified families, else 0.
molangQuery.query.has_armor_slot: Takes the armor slot index as a parameter, and returns 1.0 if the entity has armor in the requested slot, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.has_biome_tag: Returns whether or not a Block Placement Target has a specific biome tag
molangQuery.query.has_block_property: Returns 1.0 if the associated block has the given block property or 0.0 if not
molangQuery.query.has_cape: Returns 1.0 if the player has a cape, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.has_collision: Returns 1.0 if the entity has collisions enabled, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.has_dash_cooldown: Returns 1.0 if the entity has cooldown on its dash, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.has_gravity: Returns 1.0 if the entity is affected by gravity, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.has_owner: Returns true if the entity has an owner ID else it returns false
molangQuery.query.has_property: Takes one argument: the name of the property on the Actor. Returns 1.0 if a property with the given name exists, 0 otherwise.
molangQuery.query.has_rider: Returns 1.0 if the entity has a rider, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.has_target: Returns 1.0 if the entity has a target, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.head_roll_angle: Returns the roll angle of the head of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.head_x_rotation: Takes one argument as a parameter.  Returns the nth head x rotation of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.head_y_rotation: Takes one argument as a parameter.  Returns the nth head y rotation of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.health: Returns the health of the entity, or 0.0 if it doesn't make sense to call on this entity.
molangQuery.query.heartbeat_interval: Returns the heartbeat interval of the actor in seconds. Returns 0 when the actor has no heartbeat.
molangQuery.query.heartbeat_phase: Returns the heartbeat phase of the actor. 0.0 if at start of current heartbeat, 1.0 if at the end. Returns 0 on errors or when the actor has no heartbeat. Available on the Client (Resource Packs) only.
molangQuery.query.hurt_direction: Returns the hurt direction for the actor, otherwise returns 0.
molangQuery.query.hurt_time: Returns the hurt time for the actor, otherwise returns 0.
molangQuery.query.in_range: Requires 3 numerical arguments: some value, a minimum, and a maximum. If the first argument is between the minimum and maximum (inclusive), returns 1.0. Otherwise returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.invulnerable_ticks: Returns the number of ticks of invulnerability the entity has left if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_admiring: Returns 1.0 if the entity is admiring, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_alive: Returns 1.0 if the entity is alive, and 0.0 if it's dead.
molangQuery.query.is_angry: Returns 1.0 if the entity is angry, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_attached_to_entity: Returns 1.0 if the actor is attached to an entity, else it will return 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_avoiding_block: Returns 1.0 if the entity is fleeing from a block, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_avoiding_mobs: Returns 1.0 if the entity is fleeing from mobs, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_baby: Returns 1.0 if the entity is a baby, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_breathing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is breathing, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_bribed: Returns 1.0 if the entity has been bribed, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_carrying_block: Returns 1.0 if the entity is carrying a block, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_casting: Returns 1.0 if the entity is casting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_celebrating: Returns 1.0 if the entity is celebrating, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_celebrating_special: Returns 1.0 if the entity is doing a special celebration, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_charged: Returns 1.0 if the entity is charged, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_charging: Returns 1.0 if the entity is charging, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_chested: Returns 1.0 if the entity has chests attached to it, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_critical: Returns 1.0 if the entity is critical, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_croaking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is croaking, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_dancing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is dancing, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_delayed_attacking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is attacking using the delayed attack, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_digging: Returns 1.0 if the entity is digging, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_eating: Returns 1.0 if the entity is eating, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_eating_mob: Returns 1.0 if the entity is eating a mob, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_elder: Returns 1.0 if the entity is an elder version of it, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_emerging: Returns 1.0 if the entity is emerging, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_emoting: Returns 1.0 if the entity is emoting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_enchanted: Returns 1.0 if the entity is enchanted, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_feeling_happy: [EXPERIMENTAL] Returns 1.0 if the entity is feeling happy, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_fire_immune: Returns 1.0 if the entity is immune to fire, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_first_person: Returns 1.0 if the entity is being rendered in first person mode, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_ghost: Returns 1.0 if an entity is a ghost, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_gliding: Returns 1.0 if the entity is gliding, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_grazing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is grazing, or 0.0 if not.
molangQuery.query.is_idling: Returns 1.0 if the entity is idling, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_ignited: Returns 1.0 if the entity is ignited, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_illager_captain: Returns 1.0 if the entity is an illager captain, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_in_contact_with_water: Returns 1.0 if the entity is in contact with any water (water, rain, splash water bottle), else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_in_love: Returns 1.0 if the entity is in love, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_in_ui: Returns 1.0 if the entity is rendered as part of the UI, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_in_water: Returns 1.0 if the entity is in water, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_in_water_or_rain: Returns 1.0 if the entity is in water or rain, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_interested: Returns 1.0 if the entity is interested, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_invisible: Returns 1.0 if the entity is invisible, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_item_equipped: Takes one optional hand slot as a parameter (0 or 'main_hand' for main hand, 1 or 'off_hand' for off hand), and returns 1.0 if there is an item in the requested slot (defaulting to the main hand if no parameter is supplied), otherwise returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_item_name_any: Takes an equipment slot name (see the replaceitem command) and an optional slot index value. (The slot index is required for slot names that have multiple slots, for example 'slot.hotbar'.) After that, takes one or more full name (with 'namespace:') strings to check for. Returns 1.0 if an item in the specified slot has any of the specified names, otherwise returns 0.0. An empty string '' can be specified to check for an empty slot. Note that querying slot.enderchest, slot.saddle, slot.armor, or slot.chest will only work in behavior packs. A preferred query to query.get_equipped_item_name, as it can be adjusted by Mojang to avoid breaking content if names are changed.
molangQuery.query.is_jump_goal_jumping: Returns 1.0 if the entity is doing a jump goal jump, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_jumping: Returns 1.0 if the entity is jumping, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_laying_down: Returns 1.0 if the entity is laying down, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_laying_egg: Returns 1.0 if the entity is laying an egg, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_leashed: Returns 1.0 if the entity is leashed to something, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_levitating: Returns 1.0 if the entity is levitating, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_lingering: Returns 1.0 if the entity is lingering, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_local_player: Takes no arguments. Returns 1.0 if the entity is the local player for the current game window, else it returns 0.0. In splitscreen returns 0.0 for the other local players for other views. Always returns 0.0 if used in a behavior pack.
molangQuery.query.is_moving: Returns 1.0 if the entity is moving, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_name_any: Takes one or more arguments. If the entity's name is any of the specified string values, returns 1.0. Otherwise returns 0.0. A preferred query to query.get_name, as it can be adjusted by Mojang to avoid breaking content if names are changed.
molangQuery.query.is_on_fire: Returns 1.0 if the entity is on fire, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_on_ground: Returns 1.0 if the entity is on the ground, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_on_screen: Returns 1.0 if this is called on an entity at a time when it is known if it is on screen, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_onfire: Returns 1.0 if the entity is on fire, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_orphaned: Returns 1.0 if the entity is orphaned, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_owner_identifier_any: Takes one or more arguments. Returns whether the root actor identifier is any of the specified strings. A preferred query to query.owner_identifier, as it can be adjusted by Mojang to avoid breaking content if names are changed.
molangQuery.query.is_persona_or_premium_skin: Returns 1.0 if the player has a persona or premium skin, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_playing_dead: Returns 1.0 if the entity is playing dead, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_powered: Returns 1.0 if the entity is powered, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_pregnant: Returns 1.0 if the entity is pregnant, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_ram_attacking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is using a ram attack, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_resting: Returns 1.0 if the entity is resting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_riding: Returns 1.0 if the entity is riding, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_rising: [EXPERIMENTAL] Returns 1.0 if the entity is rising, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_roaring: Returns 1.0 if the entity is currently roaring, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_rolling: Returns 1.0 if the entity is rolling, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_saddled: Returns 1.0 if the entity has a saddle, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_scared: Returns 1.0 if the entity is scared, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_scenting: [EXPERIMENTAL] Returns 1.0 if the entity is scenting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_searching: [EXPERIMENTAL] Returns 1.0 if the entity is searching, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_selected_item: Returns true if the player has selected an item in the inventory, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_shaking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is casting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_shaking_wetness: Returns 1.0 if the entity is shaking water off, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sheared: Returns 1.0 if the entity is able to be sheared and is sheared, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_shield_powered: Returns 1.0f if the entity has an active powered shield if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_silent: Returns 1.0 if the entity is silent, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sitting: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sitting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sleeping: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sleeping, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sneaking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sneaking, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sneezing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sneezing, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sniffing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sniffing, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sonic_boom: Returns 1.0 if the entity is using sonic boom, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_spectator: Returns 1.0 if the entity is spectator, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_sprinting: Returns 1.0 if the entity is sprinting, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_stackable: Returns 1.0 if the entity is stackable, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_stalking: Returns 1.0 if the entity is stalking, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_standing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is standing, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_stunned: Returns 1.0 if the entity is currently stunned, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_swimming: Returns 1.0 if the entity is swimming, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_tamed: Returns 1.0 if the entity is tamed, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_transforming: Returns 1.0 if the entity is transforming, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_using_item: Returns 1.0 if the entity is using an item, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.is_wall_climbing: Returns 1.0 if the entity is climbing a wall, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.item_in_use_duration: Returns the amount of time an item has been in use in seconds up to the maximum duration, else 0.0 if it doesn't make sense.
molangQuery.query.item_is_charged: Takes one optional hand slot as a parameter (0 or 'main_hand' for main hand, 1 or 'off_hand' for off hand), and returns 1.0 if the item is charged in the requested slot (defaulting to the main hand if no parameter is supplied), otherwise returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.item_max_use_duration: Returns the maximum amount of time the item can be used, else 0.0 if it doesn't make sense.
molangQuery.query.item_remaining_use_duration: Returns the amount of time an item has left to use, else 0.0 if it doesn't make sense.Item queried is specified by the slot name 'main_hand' or 'off_hand'.Time remaining is normalized using the normalization value, only if one is given, else it is returned in seconds.
molangQuery.query.item_slot_to_bone_name: query.item_slot_to_bone_name requires one parameter: the name of the equipment slot.  This function returns the name of the bone this entity has mapped to that slot.
molangQuery.query.key_frame_lerp_time: Returns the ratio between the previous and next key frames.
molangQuery.query.last_frame_time: Returns the time in *seconds* of the last frame.  If an argument is passed, it is assumed to be the number of frames in the past that you wish to query.  'query.last_frame_time' (or the equivalent 'query.last_frame_time(0)') will return the frame time of the frame before the current one.  'query.last_frame_time(1)' will return the frame time of two frames ago.  Currently we store the history of the last 30 frames, although note that this may change in the future.  Passing an index more than the available data will return the oldest frame stored.
molangQuery.query.last_hit_by_player: Returns 1.0 if the entity was last hit by the player, else it returns 0.0. If called by the client always returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.lie_amount: Returns the lie down amount for the entity.
molangQuery.query.life_span: Returns the limited life span of an entity, or 0.0 if it lives forever
molangQuery.query.life_time: Returns the time in seconds since the current animation started, else 0.0 if not called within an animation.
molangQuery.query.lod_index: Takes an array of distances and returns the zero - based index of which range the actor is in based on distance from the camera. For example, 'query.lod_index(10, 20, 30)' will return 0, 1, or 2 based on whether the mob is less than 10, 20, or 30 units away from the camera, or it will return 3 if it is greater than 30.
molangQuery.query.log: debug log a value to the content log
molangQuery.query.main_hand_item_max_duration: Returns the use time maximum duration for the main hand item if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.main_hand_item_use_duration: Returns the use time for the main hand item.
molangQuery.query.max_durability: Returns the max durability an item can take.
molangQuery.query.max_health: Returns the maximum health of the entity, or 0.0 if it doesn't make sense to call on this entity.
molangQuery.query.max_trade_tier: Returns the maximum trade tier of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.maximum_frame_time: Returns the time in *seconds* of the most expensive frame over the last 'n' frames.  If an argument is passed, it is assumed to be the number of frames in the past that you wish to query.  'query.maximum_frame_time' (or the equivalent 'query.maximum_frame_time(0)') will return the frame time of the frame before the current one.  'query.maximum_frame_time(1)' will return the maximum frame time of the previous two frames.  Currently we store the history of the last 30 frames, although note that this may change in the future.  Asking for more frames will result in only sampling the number of frames stored.
molangQuery.query.minimum_frame_time: Returns the time in *seconds* of the least expensive frame over the last 'n' frames.  If an argument is passed, it is assumed to be the number of frames in the past that you wish to query.  'query.minimum_frame_time' (or the equivalent 'query.minimum_frame_time(0)') will return the frame time of the frame before the current one.  'query.minimum_frame_time(1)' will return the minimum frame time of the previous two frames.  Currently we store the history of the last 30 frames, although note that this may change in the future.  Asking for more frames will result in only sampling the number of frames stored.
molangQuery.query.model_scale: Returns the scale of the current entity.
molangQuery.query.modified_distance_moved: Returns the total distance the entity has moved horizontally in meters (since the entity was last loaded, not necessarily since it was originally created) modified along the way by status flags such as is_baby or on_fire.
molangQuery.query.modified_move_speed: Returns the current walk speed of the entity modified by status flags such as is_baby or on_fire.
molangQuery.query.moon_brightness: Returns the brightness of the moon (FULL_MOON=1.0, WANING_GIBBOUS=0.75, FIRST_QUARTER=0.5, WANING_CRESCENT=0.25, NEW_MOON=0.0, WAXING_CRESCENT=0.25, LAST_QUARTER=0.5, WAXING_GIBBOUS=0.75).
molangQuery.query.moon_phase: Returns the phase of the moon (FULL_MOON=0, WANING_GIBBOUS=1, FIRST_QUARTER=2, WANING_CRESCENT=3, NEW_MOON=4, WAXING_CRESCENT=5, LAST_QUARTER=6, WAXING_GIBBOUS=7).
molangQuery.query.movement_direction: Returns the specified axis of the normalized position delta of the entity.
molangQuery.query.on_fire_time: Returns the time that the entity is on fire, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.out_of_control: Returns 1.0 if the entity is out of control, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.overlay_alpha: DEPRECATED (Do not use - this function is deprecated and will be removed).
molangQuery.query.owner_identifier: DEPRECATED (Use query.is_owner_identifier_any instead if possible so names can be changed later without breaking content.) Returns the root actor identifier.
molangQuery.query.player_level: Returns the players level if the actor is a player, otherwise returns 0.
molangQuery.query.position: Returns the absolute position of an actor.  Takes one argument that represents the desired axis (0 == x-axis, 1 == y-axis, 2 == z-axis).
molangQuery.query.position_delta: Returns the position delta for an actor.  Takes one argument that represents the desired axis (0 == x-axis, 1 == y-axis, 2 == z-axis).
molangQuery.query.previous_squish_value: Returns the previous squish value for the current entity, or 0.0 if this doesn't make sense.
molangQuery.query.property: Takes one argument: the name of the property on the entity. Returns the value of that property if it exists, else 0.0 if not.
molangQuery.query.remaining_durability: Returns the how much durability an item has remaining.
molangQuery.query.roll_counter: Returns the roll counter of the entity.
molangQuery.query.rotation_to_camera: Returns the rotation required to aim at the camera.  Requires one argument representing the rotation axis you would like (0 for x, 1 for y).
molangQuery.query.shake_angle: Returns the shaking angle of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.shake_time: Returns the shake time of the entity.
molangQuery.query.shield_blocking_bob: Returns the how much the offhand shield should translate down when blocking and being hit.
molangQuery.query.show_bottom: Returns 1.0 if we render the entity's bottom, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.sit_amount: Returns the current sit amount of the entity.
molangQuery.query.sleep_rotation: Returns the rotation of the bed the player is sleeping on.
molangQuery.query.sneeze_counter: Returns the sneeze counter of the entity.
molangQuery.query.spellcolor: Returns a struct representing the entity spell color for the specified entity. The struct contains '.r' '.g' '.b' and '.a' members, each 0.0 to 1.0. If no actor is specified, each member value will be 0.0.
molangQuery.query.standing_scale: Returns the scale of how standing up the entity is.
molangQuery.query.structural_integrity: Returns the structural integrity for the actor, otherwise returns 0.
molangQuery.query.surface_particle_color: Returns the particle color for the block located in the surface below the actor (scanned up to 10 blocks down). The struct contains '.r' '.g' '.b' and '.a' members, each 0.0 to 1.0. If no actor is specified or if no surface is found, each member value is set to 0.0. Available on the Client (Resource Packs) only.
molangQuery.query.surface_particle_texture_coordinat: Returns the texture coordinate for generating particles for the block located in the surface below the actor (scanned up to 10 blocks down) in a struct with 'u' and 'v' keys. If no actor is specified or if no surface is found, u and v will be 0.0. Available on the Client (Resource Packs) only.
molangQuery.query.surface_particle_texture_size: Returns the texture size for generating particles for the block located in the surface below the actor (scanned up to 10 blocks down). If no actor is specified or if no surface is found, each member value will be 0.0. Available on the Client (Resource Packs) only.
molangQuery.query.swell_amount: Returns how swollen the entity is.
molangQuery.query.swelling_dir: Returns the swelling direction of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.swim_amount: Returns the amount the current entity is swimming.
molangQuery.query.tail_angle: Returns the angle of the tail of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.target_x_rotation: Returns the x rotation required to aim at the entity's current target if it has one, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.target_y_rotation: Returns the y rotation required to aim at the entity's current target if it has one, else it returns 0.0.
molangQuery.query.texture_frame_index: Returns the icon index of the experience orb.
molangQuery.query.time_of_day: Returns the time of day (midnight=0.0, sunrise=0.25, noon=0.5, sunset=0.75) of the dimension the entity is in.
molangQuery.query.time_since_last_vibration_detectio: Returns the time in seconds since the last vibration detected by the actor. On errors or if no vibration has been detected yet, returns -1. Available on the Client (Resource Packs) only.
molangQuery.query.time_stamp: Returns the current time stamp of the level
molangQuery.query.total_emitter_count: Returns the total number of active emitters in the world.
molangQuery.query.total_particle_count: Returns the total number of active particles in the world.
molangQuery.query.trade_tier: Returns the trade tier of the entity if it makes sense, else it returns 0.0
molangQuery.query.unhappy_counter: Returns how unhappy the entity is.
molangQuery.query.vertical_speed: Returns the speed of the entity up or down in meters/second, where positive is up.
molangQuery.query.walk_distance: Returns the walk distance of the entity.
molangQuery.query.wing_flap_position: Returns the wing flap position of the entity, or 0.0 if this doesn't make sense.
molangQuery.query.wing_flap_speed: Returns the wing flap speed of the entity, or 0.0 if this doesn't make sense.

molangQueryExperimental.query.biome_has_all_tags: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes either no position (assumes the current entity position) or three parameters: x, y, z (representing the world-origin-relative position), followed by whatever tags you want to query for, and returns 1 if all of them exist in the biome, else it returns 0.  Eg: query.biome_has_all_tags('is_cold', 'has_trees').
molangQueryExperimental.query.biome_has_any_tag: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes either no position (assumes the current entity position) or three parameters: x, y, z (representing the world-origin-relative position), followed by whatever tags you want to query for, and returns 1 if any of them exist in the biome, else it returns 0.  Eg: query.biome_has_any_tag('is_cold', 'has_trees').
molangQueryExperimental.query.block_has_all_tags: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes a world-origin-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has all of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.block_has_any_tag: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes a world-origin-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has any of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.block_neighbor_has_all_tags: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes a block-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has all of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.block_neighbor_has_any_tag: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes a block-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has any of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.bone_orientation_matrix: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes the name of the bone as an argument. Returns the bone orientation (as a matrix) of the desired bone provided it exists in the queryable geometry of the mob, else this returns the identity matrix and throws a content error.
molangQueryExperimental.query.bone_orientation_trs: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) TRS stands for Translate/Rotate/Scale.  Takes the name of the bone as an argument.  Returns the bone orientation matrix decomposed into the component translation/rotation/scale parts of the desired bone provided it exists in the queryable geometry of the mob, else this returns the identity matrix and throws a content error.  The returned value is returned as a variable of type 'struct' with members '.t', '.r', and '.s', each with members '.x', '.y', and '.z', and can be accessed as per the following example: v.my_variable = q.bone_orientation_trs('rightarm'); return v.my_variable.r.x;
molangQueryExperimental.query.client_input_type: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns either 'mouse', 'touch', 'gamepad', or 'motion_controller' depending on the type of input used by the current client.
molangQueryExperimental.query.cooldown_time: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the total cooldown time in seconds for the item held or worn by the specified equipment slot name (and optional second numerical slot id), otherwise returns 0. Uses the same name and id that the replaceitem command takes when querying entities.
molangQueryExperimental.query.cooldown_time_remaining: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the cooldown time remaining in seconds for specified cooldown type or the item held or worn by the specified equipment slot name (and optional second numerical slot id), otherwise returns 0. Uses the same name and id that the replaceitem command takes when querying entities. Returns highest cooldown if no parameters are supplied.
molangQueryExperimental.query.get_nearby_entities: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the list of entities within the specified distance, taking an optional second argument as a filter for which mob types to accept (eg: 'minecraft:pig').
molangQueryExperimental.query.get_nearby_entities_except_self: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the list of entities within the specified distance, taking an optional second argument as a filter for which mob types to accept (eg: 'minecraft:pig').
molangQueryExperimental.query.get_ride: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the entity this entity is riding if it is riding something, else it returns 0.
molangQueryExperimental.query.get_riders: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the array of entities that are riding this entity.
molangQueryExperimental.query.has_player_rider: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns 1 if the entity has a player riding it, else it returns 0.
molangQueryExperimental.query.is_attached: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns 1.0 if the actor is attached to another actor (such as being held or worn), else it will return 0.0.
molangQueryExperimental.query.is_cooldown_type: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns 1.0 if the specified held or worn item has the specified cooldown type name, otherwise returns 0.0. First argument is the cooldown name to check for, second argument is the equipment slot name, and optional third argument is the numerical slot id. For second and third arguments, uses the same name and id that the replaceitem command takes when querying entities.
molangQueryExperimental.query.relative_block_has_all_tags: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes an entity-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has all of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.relative_block_has_any_tag: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Takes an entity-relative position and one or more tag names, and returns either 0 or 1 based on if the block at that position has any of the tags provided.
molangQueryExperimental.query.scoreboard: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) DEPRECATED (The coming Actor Property feature will replace the need for querying hidden scoreboard data. Current client-side scoreboard code is only meant for supporting the standard UI elements.) Takes one argument - the name of the scoreboard entry for this entity.  Returns the specified scoreboard value for this entity.
molangQueryExperimental.query.self: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the current entity.
molangQueryExperimental.query.target: (EXPERIMENTAL. Enable 'Molang Features' to use.) Returns the target of the current entity if one exists.
